poem:
Resistance  

In the cough of the world, airborne  
whispers weave through thin air—  
cut loose, a dark seed  
grows between borders.  

Without touch, it shifts,  
untamed—bare fists against  
our fading hope,  
seeping through the veins  
of time, a byword,  
a shadow in lung's embrace,  
patient and silent,  
crafting its relentless hue.
